title: Entrance Hall, Moffatt-Ladd House
description:
Entrance Hall, Moffatt-Ladd House

Signed and dated Walter Gay 1923
Gouache on paper
11 x 16 inches (27.9 x 40.6 cm)
Framed: 16 x 21 inches (40.6 x 53.3 cm)

Located in Portsmouth, New Hampshire, the Moffatt-Ladd House is a Georgian style mansion built for merchant John Moffatt between 1760 and 1763. Now an historic house museum, the house's entrance hall looks very similar to Walter Gay's 1923 rendering.

Provenance
Estate of Henry Francis du Pont, Winterthur, Delaware, 1974
Private Collection, Pennsylvania
Available at Mark Murray Gallery

title: Library at Château du Bréau
description:
Library at Château du Bréau

Signed Walter Gay
Watercolor on board
18 x 15 inches (45.7 x 38.1 cm)
Framed: 26 x 22 inches (66 x 56 cm)

Built in 1705, the four-story Château du Bréau was located on a 300-acre walled park near the Forest of Fontainebleau. Walter Gay and his wife Matilda purchased the house in 1907, and hosted many famous names of the age, including Edith Wharton, Henry James, Elsie de Wolfe, Mrs. William K. Vanderbilt, John Singer Sargent, and Paul Helleu. Admired by all who visited, the house is said to have been Edith Wharton's model for the Château Givre in her novel, The Reef.

Walter Gay painted several views of the library at Bréau and one, an oil depicting the same corner of the room as the present watercolor, was acquired from the artist by Archer M. Huntington and given to the Smith College Museum of Art in Northampton, Massachusetts in 1925.

Provenance
Wadsworth Collection, Geneseo, New York
Available at Mark Murray Gallery

Literature
cf. William Rieder, A Charmed Couple: The Art and Life of Walter and Matilda Gay, New York, 2000, p. 62, fig. 40, for illustration of the related Smith College painting

title: Porcelains, Château du Bréau
description:
Porcelains, Château du Bréau

Signed Walter Gay
Oil on canvas
21¾ x 18¼ inches (55.2 x 46.4 cm)
Framed: 29 x 25 inches (73.8 x 63.6 cm)

Provenance
M. Knoedler & Co., New York
Clarence L. Hay, New York, by 1920
E. Gimpel & Wildenstein, New York
Sale, Doyle, New York, 21 October 1987, lot 91, illustrated, sold for $27,500
Private collection (Acquired by the previous owner from the above)
Available at Mark Murray Gallery

Exhibited
New York, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, Memorial Exhibition of Paintings by Walter Gay, 1938, no. 14
New York, James Graham & Sons, Walter Gay: Poèmes d'Intérieurs, 2003

Literature
Albert Eugene Gallatin, Walter Gay: Paintings of French Interiors, New York, 1920, pl. 29, illustrated

title: View into the Dining Room, Le Bréau
description:
View into the Dining Room, Le Bréau

Signed Walter Gay
Oil on board
25½ x 19½ inches (64.7 x 49.5 cm)
Framed: 32 x 26 inches (81.2 x 66 cm)

The same clock appears in a work titled La Régence Clock, in which it is situated, instead of at Le Bréau, in Walter Gay's Paris apartment at 11, rue de l'Université [see Gallatin, 1938, no. 38].

Provenance
McClees Galleries, Philadelphia
Private Collection, New York
Available at Mark Murray Gallery

Exhibited
New York, James Graham & Sons, Walter Gay: Poèmes d'Intérieurs, 2003, no. 19, illustrated

Literature
cf. Albert Eugene Gallatin, Walter Gay: Paintings of French Interiors, New York, 1920, no. 38, for illustration of The Régence Clock
